div1.p: Latimer elaborates the differences between the first and second editions of the book: Walter Reed and Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Caroline Latimer to [s.n.] Waterson, September 25, 1912
div1.p:
Your note is just
received after many
wanderings. The per-
sonal copy of Walter
Reed is, I think, the
first edition. A
good many changes
were made in the
second and last
which was issued ab-
out a year after the
first. I do not know
of any changes to be
made, if the second
edition is used
to print from, but
it would be disas-
trous to use the
first. The second
edition contains a
good deal of infor-
mation about Dr.
Carroll which is not
in the first, because
Dr. Kelly did not not
know it, when the
first was written. There is
no list put away nor
any changes that I know
of to be made, except
that I think Dr. Caroll's
death has occurred since
the second edition in
which case the fact shd.
be mentioned with the
statement that the heart
complaint from which he
died was due to the
experimental attack of
yellow fever. I do not
remember the exact date
of his death, but it is in
the Cyclopedia of medical
men.
